subject: Re: Online - Latest staging site feedback
preview: @joel thanks I have emailed Una about the updates. I'll close this ticket for now.

full_threads.body: @joel thanks I have emailed Una about the updates. I'll close this ticket for now.

@heath Please see below

Homepage
- Done

Meet our team
- Done

What we do
- Done

Explore our Work
- The font of the titles for each case study seem very big (as they do currently) so what size are these?
* font-size: 25px !important;

Browse Industry News:
- Can we update the header image to be the one attached.. by Jacek-dylag (unsplash), with a navy tint… as per what you’re using (or can you tell me how to update these images?)
* Currently to edit this, you need to edit a php file.

The new future of work
- Done

Case Study pages
- Done

In the Industry News section, when click through to individual stories
- Done

Contact using
- Done

@rica +3hrs Thanks!

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi @joel we received some extra changes from Una, please see below and my message to her. I have also uploaded the files she refers to here:
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/bp2exn6ulhomf8t/AACDqRL4YaBDLpnCejenhX2oa?dl=0

Maybe you can tackle some of the ones that she definitely can’t do.

Thanks!

Hi Una,

Thanks for the below, good to see you are receiving my emails too.

Regarding accessing the site, you can head to https://staging-veldhoen2019.temp513.kinsta.cloud/wp-admin/ <https://staging-veldhoen2019.temp513.kinsta.cloud/wp-admin/> - it’s the same logins as the live site and there is a password reset button if needed.

Did you want to let me know which elements you will take care of? Reason I ask is I will need to start tracking the time required to make these changes as we are well over our original estimate. I trust that works for you?

Let me know and then we can proceed with the below. Thanks and speak soon,
Heath Maguire
DIRECTOR

Phone: 1300 072 134 <tel:1300 072 134>
Mobile: 0415 162 271 <tel:0415 162 271>
Email: heath@wpperk.com <mailto:heath@wpperk.com>

<https://wpperk.com/>

> On 9 Nov 2020, at 7:00 pm, Una Mapes <una@veldhoencompany.com <mailto:una@veldhoencompany.com>> wrote:
>
> Hi Heath
>
> Thanks for this! I appreciate there are lots of different elements, and I’m not sure where you’ve now got to with the Miro board feedback, but a number of things flagged a while ago are outstanding so if there’s any way I can help on this I would gladly jump in to help ensure we’re being consistent.
>
> If the back end has been set up to update font sizes, colours, images etc then I can hop in (if allowed) and do some of these points to help. And with this in mind, here is my feedback on the latest staging site. 😊
>
>
> Can you confirm the different options we’ll have in terms of font style, size and colours? As would be great to have a consistency and a clear hierarchy of sizes throughout.
> Can I update things in the staging site? Or at what point can I dive in before it goes live.. as there are quite a few things that I could help with, in terms of making it consistent.
>
>
> Homepage:
> IMAGE – can we test the attached image by Nicolas-j for the home page image? With a blue overlay as per brand- although would still be good to know what percentage you’re using… 40%? I didn’t hear back on that. (image sent via wetransfer)
>
> <image001.png>
>
> On the home page the font within the body copy of the Q+A section, seems bigger than the font in the body copy of the main message above ‘Veldhoen’s mission..’
> What is the font being used for both the Q and the A section here?
> The navigation bar text is very faint, can we make these the medium versions of these fonts?
>
> <image002.png>… the top one is how it looks on the staging site compared to the current version below.
> <image003.png>
>
>
>
> Meet our team:
> can we see what its like with the Eau de Nil flowing across the page so the full width of the space is taken with the colour? Not separated out into cards? We could keep the words ‘Meet our team’ and countries with the white background.
> The job titles are faint, can we have these in the medium version of that font? (these are things I could help with, if I had access)
> <image004.png>
>
>
>
> What we do
> Can we update the main header image to be a crop of the shutterstock image, with a navy overlay? It may not be right though, so how can I change these images myself?
>
> <image005.png>
>
> Can we update the titles that are beside the + signs to our navy? We had asked for them to be in red but they didn’t change, so if the subtitles are staying in teal please can we have the titles in navy
> These titles also need to be slightly bigger than the subtitles, so would be great to know the font sizes being used throughout so we can identify what our options are
> Also these subtitles don’t need to be justified in terms of layout, as they look extremely spaced out when justified – see below
> <image006.png>
> <image007.png>
>
>
> Explore our Work:
> The font of the titles for each case study seem very big (as they do currently) so what size are these?
>
>
>
> Browse Industry News:
> The words ‘Industry News’ don’t stay red when on that page, please can we update
> Can we update the header image to be the one attached.. by Jacek-dylag (unsplash), with a navy tint… as per what you’re using (or can you tell me how to update these images?)
>
> <image008.png>
>
>
>
> The new future of work
> Thanks for removing the extra ‘read more’ sections. Could we also still have the layout of the body copy and latest story image updated in size as requested, on the original brief? See notes below from Miro board.
> Also re the headline size, would be good to decrease this in size… see below… this is where we need to be consistent with hierarchy of messaging… and where I can hop in and adjust if possible
>
> <image009.png>
>
>
>
> Case Study pages:
> There are lots of inconsistencies in terms of font sizes between different case studies.. so where can I help? I’m not sure if these sections have been fully completed yet, so apologies if the feedback below is covering work yet to be completed….
> But if you look at the following screenshots of the first two case studies – they are different… the first has a really small subtitle in the trade gothic font, the other subhead is using the Soho Gothic font… We’re working towards all headlines being in caps, so if these could be changed, then the subtitles to be a consistent size. I can update the headlines into caps if that helps, but let me know!
>
> <image010.png> <image011.png>
> Also the quotes need to be in the Minion Pro italic font, but not caps.. the size of these quotes are now huge, so we need to consider the hierarchy of messaging again.
> There are some coloured bars appearing on some pages
> Spaces have appeared above the words for each section, can we tighten these up?
> The words ‘Project Gallery’ are not being seen, could these be in the navy and in caps? There’s also lots of space above these words that we don’t need..
> <image012.png>
> The ‘Contact’ section at the bottom – can this Eau de Nil stretch across the width of the page as per requested above, so not appearing in little boxes?
> The font in these sections needs to be updated to stand out clearly… e,g the word Asia could be in navy, the rest could be in the medium version of the font.
> <image013.png>
>
>
>
> In the Industry News section, when click through to individual stories:
> Headline to be in caps
> Subhead to be in navy caps and smaller than the headline.. goes back to having a clear hierarchy of messaging with our font sizes
> Where we have contact details using the Eau de Nil background, we need to update the text to make the words stand out as best they can. Ref comments mentioned above. Also in this instance, the background colour to the photo has changed, please can we have this back to the original so the circle stands out?
>
> <image014.png>
>
>
>
>
> Contact us:
> Can we test the image here; to update it to the two attached? We’re not sure how they will look with the navy overlay… or tell me how I can update these and I can test them.
>
> <image015.png> or…. <image016.png> (forest image sent via wetransfer)
> Can we have the Eau de Nil colour spread the width of the page?
> The names of the different entities could all be in navy… keep the red ‘+’ as requested and shown (thank-you), but update the rest of the words each time to be navy
> <image017.png>
>
>
> Thanks Heath – appreciate your support with this, and again let me know how I can help when it comes to consistency!
>
> Cheers
> Una
>
>
> Una Mapes
> Marketing Director
>
> <image018.png> <https://www.veldhoencompany.com/en/>
> Veldhoen + Company PTY Ltd
> +61 468 300 292 | una@veldhoencompany.com <mailto:una@veldhoencompany.com>
